body:
Time in status messages logged from `golang.sh` is `GMT+0` for some reason. I'm in `GMT+2`. 

The strange thing is that they both seem to use the same function `kube::log::status` in `cluster/lib/logging.sh`
Example output: 

```
$ make quick-release
KUBE_RELEASE_RUN_TESTS=n build/release.sh
----------------------- RIGHT ---------------------------
+++ [0207 20:46:50] Verifying Prerequisites....
+++ [0207 20:46:50] Building Docker image kube-build:cross-1.4.2-2.
+++ [0207 20:57:58] Building Docker image kube-build:build-b54447e80c.
+++ [0207 20:58:54] Running build command....
-------------------- WRONG -----------------------------
+++ [0207 18:58:55] Multiple platforms requested and available 13G >= threshold 11G, building platforms in parallel
+++ [0207 18:58:55] Building go targets for linux/amd64
    linux/arm in parallel (output will appear in a burst when complete):
    cmd/kube-proxy
    cmd/kube-apiserver
    cmd/kube-controller-manager
    cmd/kubelet
    cmd/kubemark
    cmd/hyperkube
    cmd/linkcheck
    plugin/cmd/kube-scheduler
+++ [0207 18:58:55] linux/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:01:46] linux/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 18:58:55] linux/arm: go build started
+++ [0207 19:01:46] linux/arm: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] Multiple platforms requested and available 13G >= threshold 11G, building platforms in parallel
+++ [0207 19:01:46] Building go targets for linux/amd64
    linux/386
    linux/arm
    darwin/amd64
    darwin/386
    windows/amd64
    windows/386 in parallel (output will appear in a burst when complete):
    cmd/kubectl
+++ [0207 19:01:46] linux/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:02:20] linux/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] linux/386: go build started
+++ [0207 19:03:05] linux/386: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] linux/arm: go build started
+++ [0207 19:02:20] linux/arm: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] darwin/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:03:04] darwin/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] darwin/386: go build started
+++ [0207 19:03:06] darwin/386: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] windows/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:03:06] windows/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:01:46] windows/386: go build started
+++ [0207 19:03:05] windows/386: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:03:06] Multiple platforms requested and available 13G >= threshold 11G, building platforms in parallel
+++ [0207 19:03:06] Building go targets for linux/amd64
    darwin/amd64
    windows/amd64 in parallel (output will appear in a burst when complete):
    cmd/integration
    cmd/gendocs
    cmd/genkubedocs
    cmd/genman
    cmd/mungedocs
    cmd/genbashcomp
    cmd/genconversion
    cmd/gendeepcopy
    cmd/genswaggertypedocs
    examples/k8petstore/web-server/src
    github.com/onsi/ginkgo/ginkgo
    test/e2e/e2e.test
+++ [0207 19:03:06] linux/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:04:18] linux/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:03:06] darwin/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:05:14] darwin/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:03:06] windows/amd64: go build started
+++ [0207 19:05:14] windows/amd64: go build finished
+++ [0207 19:05:14] Placing binaries
------------------- RIGHT ---------------------------------
+++ [0207 21:06:01] Running build command....
+++ [0207 21:06:03] Output directory is local.  No need to copy results out.
+++ [0207 21:06:03] Building tarball: salt
```

This also affects `e2e` logs and is quite annoying.
@mikedanese @ixdy @zmerlynn

labels.description: Issues or PRs related to the Release Engineering subproject
labels.name: area/release-eng

title: Time(zone) logged in golang.sh is wrong
